page.title: 05The Assynt Shoot
page.content: The{Open clay pigeon shoot}is held near ruined{Calda House}on the{last {Saturday in May.}About{50 people enter including many local.They use standard size clay pigeons,made of a mixture of pitch and chalk.The traps at Calda are like big spring catapults operated by hand from a cubicle below ground. The shoot is so popular that no entries are accepted after one o'clock other- wise darkness might stop the shoot. Often a local shoot is held at Christmas time. Prizes are trophies with bottles of whisky and table prizes donated by friends of Assynt. Teas, coffees, hot soup,hamburgers and sandwiches etc.,are provided.Sometimes over anxious gunmen hit the trap before the pigeons emerge and when practising,the trapman plays tricks on the marksmen by throwing out 2 instead of 1.This is good fun & not dangerous!
